title: What happened to the Telegram owner?

The Telegram founder, Pavel Durov, sold: :briefcase: Pavel Durov steps down as CEO
Pavel Durov leaves the role of CEO after a disagreement with Elon Musk over the direction of the company.
Durov also sold some of his shares in the company, reducing his stake to around 10%.
The new CEO is Emin Aliyev, who was previously the company's Chief Operating Officer.

sections: :arrow_right: 2013 - Pavel Durov co-founds Telegram with his brother Nikolai Durov.
:arrow_right: 2014 - The brothers sell their majority stake in the company for $225 million to investors.
:arrow_right: 2021 - Elon Musk's investment firm, X Ventures, and other investors acquire a majority stake in Telegram.
:arrow_right: Present day - Pavel Durov remains involved with the company as a shareholder and advisor.
Founder and former CEO of Telegram.
:thought_balloon: Elon Musk acquires majority stake in Telegram.
:thought_balloon: Musk's investment firm, X Ventures, takes over as the new management team for the company.
:news_letter: Pavel Durov announces his departure from the CEO role.
:news_letter: Emin Aliyev assumes the role of CEO, taking over day-to-day operations of the company.
